title: About Simon Ghyselincks
text:
Welcome to my personal site! I’m Simon Ghyselincks, currently a 4th-year Engineering Physics student at the University of British Columbia (UBC), with a minor in Computer Science. My academic journey is characterized by a cross-disciplinary blend of engineering, computer science, and applied mathematics. I love coding to solve tough problems in robotics, machine learning, signals processing, and more.





In the classroom, my focus has been learning the fundamentals of machine learning, computational optimization, and systems controls, among other topics.



As I approach the completion of my degree, I’m excited about the future. My goal is to continue blending the theoretical with the practical, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in engineering and technology. Whether it’s through further research, industry projects, or entrepreneurial ventures, I’m eager to contribute to innovative solutions that address real-world problems.



Thank you for visiting my site. I hope to not only share my journey with you but also to inspire and be inspired by the passionate community of learners and innovators out there.
Feel free to connect with me on LinkedIn or check out my GitHub projects.

title: Simon Ghyselincks
text:
Research Interests

Computational Modeling and Simulation: Numerical algorithms for simulating physical systems, computational optimization, applied linear algebra, applications in robotics and signal processing.
Machine Learning and Computer Vision: Applied machine learning and deep learning, interpretable AI and network dissection, computer vision for robotics, 3D environmental reconstruction.

title: Simon Ghyselincks
text:
Research Experience

UBC ATLAS Group
USRA Undergraduate Research Assistant
Vancouver, BC, Canada
May 2023 – Aug 2023
Supervisors: Cole Helling and Alison Lister

Contributed to the testing and characterization of sensor modules for the new ATLAS detector at CERN’s Large Hadron Collider.
Identified the source of a critical software and hardware issue.
Collaborated on design and implementation of safety protocols for the controls and monitoring system.

title: Simon Ghyselincks
text:

Computer Vision - Personal
PyTorch Projects

Comparative analysis of image classification methods.

Reinforcement Learning Reaction Wheel Unicycle - Capstone
Aug 2023 - Present

Team leader in physics and control modeling, telemetry, and environmental sensing.

Engineering: Robotics, Controls, Microcontrollers (STM32, Raspberry Pi, Nvidia Jetson), FPGAs, PCB Design, Machine Design, 3D Printing, CAD (SolidWorks, Onshape), Circuit Analysis
Languages: English (Native), Spanish (Proficient), French (Proficient)
